intro: Caltha deranco, commonly known as the yellow crowfoot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China and Japan. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy flowering plants. The plant features delicate, palmate leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking native, ornamental plants.
